Apply for or renew your hackney carriage or private hire driver licence

Current processing times: Due to high application volumes, please allow 20 working days before enquiring about your application. We aim to process most applications within 14 days.
‚úì

Eligibility

  • 21 years or over
  • Full DVLA driving licence held for at least 12 continuous months
  • No more than 3 current penalty points on DVLA licence
  • Legal right to work in UK (Immigration Act 2016)
  • Must pass fit and proper person test
See all requirements
  • Must meet DVLA Group 2 medical standard
  • Must pass English language proficiency test
  • Must pass knowledge test (topographical for HC, literacy/numeracy for PH)
  • Must pass driving assessment with approved provider
  • Must complete safeguarding awareness training

Step-by-step checklist

Follow these steps to apply for your driver licence. Your progress is saved automatically.

0 of 12 steps completed (0%)
  • 1

    English Language Proficiency Test ¬£45

    MUST be completed before other requirements - strongly recommended first step

    Why first? No point spending money on other tests if cannot pass English test

    How to book: Call 01452 396396

  • 2

    Medical examination ¬£50-150

    Requirement: DVLA Group 2 standard

    Form: Council approved medical form (see downloads below)

    Important: Must be no more than 3 months old when submitted

    Cost: Varies by GP - typical ¬£50-150

    Future renewals: Every 5 years under age 65, annually over 65

  • 3

    Enhanced DBS check ¬£50-60

    Level required: Enhanced disclosure including barred lists

    Provider: Apply through TaxiPlus

    Apply for DBS check
    CRITICAL: You MUST subscribe to DBS Update Service within 28 days of receiving your certificate. Cost: ¬£13/year. This is a licence condition.
  • 4

    Certificate of Good Conduct (if applicable)

    Required if: You have lived outside UK since age 18

    Obtain from: Embassy of each country you lived in

    This can take several months to obtain - start early!

  • 5

    Driving assessment ¬£100-150

    Purpose: Assesses ability to drive safely with passengers

    Approved providers:

    • Diamond Advanced Tests
    • The Blue Lamp Trust
    • Green Penny

    Cost varies by provider - typical ¬£100-150

  • 6

    Knowledge test

    Hackney Carriage: Topographical knowledge test for Gloucester city and surrounding area. Download application form and call 01452 396396 with payment.

    Private Hire: Literacy and numeracy test (Private Hire Knowledge Test). Call 01452 396396 to pay, then licensing officer will contact to arrange.

    Retakes: Can retake up to 2 times in 12 months. If fail 3 times, cannot retake until can demonstrate learning has taken place.

  • 7

    Safeguarding awareness training

    Requirement: Mandatory for all new applicants

    How to book: Check council website for course dates and venues

    What's covered: Recognising abuse, CSE, modern slavery, how to report concerns

    Certificate required with application

  • 8

    Complete online application

    Documents needed:

    • English language test pass certificate
    • Medical certificate (less than 3 months old)
    • Enhanced DBS certificate
    • Certificate of good conduct (if applicable)
    • Driving assessment pass certificate
    • Knowledge test pass certificate
    • Safeguarding training certificate
    • Proof of right to work
    • DVLA driving licence
    • Proof of address

    Application fee: Must be paid in full when submitting - see fees and charges

    Apply online (My Gloucester)
  • 9

    NR3 database check Automatic

    What happens: Council automatically checks National Register of Refusals and Revocations

    Data checked: Name, DOB, address, National Insurance Number, driving licence number, previous refusals or revocations

    Retention: 11 years on NR3 database if refused/revoked

    Purpose: Prevent unsuitable persons being licensed elsewhere

  • 10

    Fit and proper person assessment Automatic

    Decision maker: Licensing team or Licensing Sub-Committee

    The test question: "Would you be comfortable with this person driving your loved ones?"

    We consider:

    • Criminal convictions and cautions
    • Driving record and penalty points
    • Honesty and integrity
    • Medical fitness
    • Competence (tests passed)
    • Previous licensing history

    Read more about the fit and proper test

  • 11

    Decision

    Target timeframe: Decision within 14 days (normal cases)

    Current delays: High volume - allow 20 working days before enquiring

    Possible outcomes:

    • Grant licence for 3 years
    • Grant licence for shorter period (if justified by circumstances)
    • Refuse application
    • Refer to Licensing Sub-Committee for determination

    Contact licensing@gloucester.gov.uk if delayed beyond 20 working days

  • 12

    Badge collection

    When: After licence granted and additional fee paid

    Badge requirements:

    • Wear badge at all times when working
    • Badge must be clearly visible
    • Return badge if licence suspended or revoked
    Criminal offence: Not wearing badge whilst working is a criminal offence

Should I apply for hackney carriage or private hire?

You can hold both types of licence (dual licence). Many drivers do this for flexibility.

Feature Hackney Carriage Private Hire
Street hailing ‚úì Can be hailed ‚úó Pre-booking only
Taxi ranks ‚úì Can wait at ranks ‚úó Cannot use ranks
Knowledge test Topographical (street knowledge) Literacy and numeracy
Fares Maximum set by council (tariff) Agreed with operator/customer

Have a criminal conviction? Each case is assessed individually. Use our conviction checker tool to see if your conviction may affect licensing.

Your safeguarding duties

Important responsibility

As a licensed driver, you have a duty to safeguard vulnerable passengers including children, elderly people, and those with disabilities.

What to look for

You should be aware of signs that someone may be at risk:

  • Recognising signs of abuse and neglect
  • Child Sexual Exploitation (CSE)
  • County lines and criminal exploitation
  • Modern slavery and trafficking
  • Domestic abuse
  • Prevent (radicalisation)

Note: Your mandatory safeguarding training covers these topics in detail.

How to report concerns

üìû
Immediate danger: Call 999 - Police

Child at risk

Contact: Multi-Agency Safeguarding Hub (MASH)

Vulnerable adult at risk

Contact: Adult safeguarding team

Concern about another driver

Contact: Licensing Authority - licensing@gloucester.gov.uk

Whistleblowing protection: You are protected under whistleblowing legislation when reporting genuine concerns.

Why we check your DBS

Enhanced DBS checks including barred lists ensure you're safe to work with vulnerable people. We check both children's and adults' barred lists.

DBS Update Service - MANDATORY

You MUST subscribe to DBS Update Service within 28 days of receiving your certificate.

Cost: ¬£13 per year

Benefit: Council can check online without new certificate at renewal

Failure to subscribe: Breach of licence conditions

National Register (NR3)

We share information about refused and revoked licences with other licensing authorities across the UK. This helps prevent unsuitable people being licensed elsewhere.

Retention: 11 years

Read more about how we use your data

Renew before expiry! You cannot work if your licence expires. Apply before your current licence ends.

Renewal requirements

To renew your driver licence, you need:

Medical certificate

Frequency:

  • Every 5 years if under 65
  • Annually if 65 or over
  • Sooner if medical condition develops

Validity: Less than 3 months old

DBS Update Service check

If subscribed: Council can check online - no new certificate needed

If not subscribed: New enhanced DBS certificate required

Critical: Failure to subscribe within 28 days of certificate is breach of licence conditions

DVLA licence check

Automatic: Council checks DVLA record for endorsements

Tax check

You may need to complete HMRC tax check when renewing.

Check if you need tax check

Conviction disclosure

Declare any cautions, convictions, fixed penalties, or pending prosecutions

48-hour rule: Must notify council within 48 hours of being formally notified of any conviction, caution, or arrest
üö´

Ongoing duty to disclose

You must inform the council within 48 hours of:

  • Cautions
  • Convictions
  • Fixed penalties
  • Pending prosecutions
  • Arrests (if relevant to fitness)

Method: In writing to Licensing Authority

Failure to notify: Serious breach - may result in revocation

Frequently asked questions

Getting licensed

Can I drive a taxi with my ordinary car licence?

No - you need a hackney carriage or private hire driver licence from the council in addition to your DVLA driving licence.

What's the difference between taxi and private hire?

Taxis (hackney carriages) can be hailed in street and wait at ranks. Private hire must be pre-booked through operator. Different licences and rules apply.

What if I have a criminal conviction?

Depends on type, seriousness and time elapsed. See Common Standards policy. Each case assessed individually on whether you are fit and proper person.

Use our conviction checker tool

Do I need a medical every year?

Every 5 years if under 65, annually if 65 or over, or sooner if medical condition develops.

Working as a driver

Do I have to wear my badge?

Yes. Wear badge at all times when working for hire.

Position: Clearly visible - typically on lanyard or breast pocket

Criminal offence: Not wearing badge whilst working is a criminal offence
Can I smoke in my vehicle?

No. Smoking in licensed vehicle is criminal offence

Includes: Traditional cigarettes, e-cigarettes, vaping

Applies: Even when vehicle not carrying passengers

Penalty: Fixed penalty ¬£50 or prosecution

Can I use my phone while driving?
No. Illegal to use handheld phone while driving

Hands-free permitted: But must not affect driving

Penalty: 6 points and ¬£200 fine minimum

What if a passenger leaves property in my vehicle?
  1. Check vehicle after each hiring
  2. Try to contact passenger if details available
  3. Hand unclaimed property to police within 48 hours
  4. Keep record of property found
What are the key rules for hackney carriage drivers?

You can:

  • Be hailed in street
  • Wait at designated ranks
  • Take bookings

You must:

  • Stop if available and safe when hailed
  • Maintain orderly queues at ranks
  • Charge according to meter and approved tariff
  • Cannot refuse short journeys (within district)
  • No extra charge for wheelchairs and assistance dogs
What are the key rules for private hire drivers?
Critical: Private hire drivers can ONLY accept bookings through licensed operator

You CANNOT:

  • Accept street hailing (journey uninsured if you do)
  • Wait or tout for business
  • Wait at taxi ranks (criminal offence)
  • Display 'taxi' or 'cab' signage

All bookings must go through operator who issues booking to driver.

Can I work for Uber or Lyft?

These are private hire operators. You need:

  • Private hire driver licence
  • Your vehicle needs private hire vehicle licence
  • Operator (Uber/Lyft) needs operator licence

Important: All must be from Gloucester if operating in Gloucester.

Can I drive in other areas?

Your Gloucester licence only valid for Gloucester-licensed vehicles and operators. Other areas require their licences.

What if I get points on my DVLA licence?
Must notify council within 48 hours. May affect fitness depending on circumstances.
